text: Patients with barrier-free multimedia education had a significantly lower level of anxiety and felt most satisfied with the information and materials received compared to patients in groups 1 and 3.
A total of 242 patients completed the study.
There was no significant difference between the two main guidelines, although the American Thoracic Society guideline was easier to follow.
People's beliefs about diabetes form quickly after diagnosis and then appear to be relatively stable over a longer follow-up period.
